intro: Dendrobium violaceum subsp. violaceum, commonly known as the violet-stemmed orchid, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is an epiphytic orchid that grows on trees and rocks, typically in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features long, cane-like pseudobulbs covered in a dense, violet-colored sheath. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, with a distinctive, fragrant scent. It thrives in high light conditions and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
